questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You are designing a solution to continually import data from several data sources into Microsoft Dataverse.

The solution must meet the following requirements:

• Include integrated error handling for records that fail to import successfully into Dataverse.
• Augment data with Al and machine learning models.

You need to select a component for each requirement.

Which components should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

comments.content:
1) Azure Data Factory (you cannot use an Analytical dataflow to import directly into Dataverse. That type of flow only imports into Azure Data Lake. Look it up. You are correct in that it can use AI and ML, but not into Dataverse). You can definitely use AI and machine learning with ADF to import directly into Dataverse.
2) PowerApps dataflow

discussion.content:
Requirement 1: Augment data with AI and machine learning models.
Component: Analytical dataflow

Analytical dataflow allows for data enrichment using AI and machine learning models. It includes built-in connectors to several data sources and allows for the creation of custom data enrichments using Power Query transformations.

Requirement 2: Include integrated error handling in place for records that fail to import
Component: Logic Apps

Logic Apps provides robust error handling capabilities, including the ability to configure retries, notifications, and custom workflows for handling failed records. It also includes connectors to several data sources, making it easy to integrate with other components of the solution.
Answers given are correct!

comments.content:
Analytical dataflow
Power Apps Dataflow, you can analyze each row fail when it is imported and integrated multples sources.

discussion.content:
Augment data with AI and machine learning models: Analytical dataflow
Include integrated error handling: Logic Apps

Vote:
Analytical dataflow
Power Apps Dataflow
